title: What determines the amount of products formed in a chemical reaction? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are three factors involved: Stoichiometry. This falls out of the balanced equation for the reaction and an awareness of the limiting reagent. It gives you an idealized “theoretical yield” for the reaction.Conversion. How far toward completion did the reaction proceed? This can be influenced by things like the temperature and initial concentration of the reactants. Also some reactions are equilibria which will not proceed past a certain point.Selectivity. What percentage of the starting materials are converted to product versus the percent going to side products?So your actual yield is going to be (theoretical yield) x (conversion) x (selectivity)

Stoichiometric ratio: The ratio of the coefficients of the products and reactants in a balanced reaction. This ratio can be used to calculate the amount of products or reactants produced or used in a reaction.
